BE7A0158387B4B4B82745844BEE21AE0.description: Use words and phrases acquired through conversations, reading, being read to, and responding to texts.

8DF3126D161D418FB9D88579DF46E8E2.description: Distinguish shades of meaning among verbs describing the same general action (e.g., walk, march, strut, prance) by acting out the meanings.

C090F9BFB82D4414955B0512473B1A94.description: Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., note places at school that are colorful).

3E31BB2CCBBC4710A94CEC9D37C6EF06.description: Demonstrate understanding of frequently occurring verbs and adjectives by relating them to their opposites (antonyms).

E718CB010A244F91A93C473AB0D55EB5.description: Sort common objects into categories (e.g., shapes, foods) to gain a sense of the concepts the categories represent.

8A4072A4FF2A4B9FA23C682097AA1551.description: With guidance and support from adults, explore word relationships and nuances in word meanings.

DE1DBBB599C1452F82C7320A6F06F580.description: Use the most frequently occurring inflections and affixes (e.g., -ed, -s, re-, un-, pre-, -ful, -less) as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word.

BF20236DD63C45EA92934BFA29C82DCD.description: Identify new meanings for familiar words and apply them accurately (e.g., knowing duck is a bird and learning the verb to duck).

55F1F2A13B0F4FD0B3525DED96C67C5B.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on Kindergarten reading and content.

381B8A6CDDBD4FE49AC7017DA4692E92.description:
Write a letter or letters for most consonant and short-vowel sounds (phonemes).
  • Spell consonant-vowel-consonant (CVC) words correctly.
  • Spell words phonetically, drawing on knowledge of sound-letter relationships.

AD3F462C651141F6990D3D23D3295FFD.description: Capitalize the first word in a sentence and the pronoun I.

E61F6E988376432E9036ED996842D806.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling as appropriate for Kindergarten when writing.

E486BCB528D8488F9BA2293B01CA4F0F.description: Print all upper- and lowercase letters legibly.

A8309DE0FC414E21BEF9259A8E11DCB2.description: Understand and use question words, interrogatives, (e.g., who, what, when, where, why, how).

915693427F754BBF8633B26F499906F0.description:
Independently produce and expand complete sentences in shared language activities.
  • With prompting and support, use spaces to separate words in a sentence.

3C5D3C45017940CFBFB84D9A34EEB925.description: Use the most frequently occurring prepositions (e.g., to, from, in, out, on, off, for, of, by with).

6CB15DAA275743B5B64CB7C4FEE2DBBC.description:
Use adjectives.
  • Use determiners, noun markers, to add specificity (e.g., a book, the book) begins in Grade 1.

CF04565AB5A44B19970D5CF67E68562C.description:
Use frequently occurring nouns.
  • Form regular plural nouns orally by adding /s/ or /es/ (e.g., dog, dogs; wish, wishes).

51192011B2D84B5A99C0D48330AAED2A.description: Print all upper- and lowercase letters legibly.

A35FF2D732FA42BF943DA75C4487A863.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking as appropriate for Kindergarten.

84553844C81440C6A9C1853269DEDFBB.description: Speak audibly and express thoughts, feelings, and ideas clearly.

1754F2036C5A405098EDD5AFA5C9380D.description: Add drawings or other visual displays to descriptions of familiar people, places, things, and events as desired to provide additional detail.

087E848E42FE450393075E9770541590.description: Describe familiar people, places, things, and events; provide additional details with prompting and support.

DC313CCEE2AF43C5A8128058BCAA69A0.description: Ask and answer questions in order to seek help, get information, or clarify something that is not understood.

0B53DD9D6DD04A4296ECB280CAF0E644.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details to demonstrate understanding of a topic read aloud, presented orally, or through other media.

31CD20FADC404AF9B8E77CF7C4D688A2.description: Continue a conversation through multiple exchanges.

A5FA4220DCF0468CBE1E13134C96096D.description: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g., listening to others and taking turns speaking about the topics and texts under discussion)

A0287F154DAB4CAF91D322F593D9A5FB.description: Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse partners about Kindergarten topics and texts with peers and adults in small and larger groups.

3541BE7C690A4AD9A0C7738BFE4C2D92.description: With prompting and support write routinely over short time frames for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences.

5D6AD4DAFC6B466FADDCC80AECFDB1E3.description: With prompting and support, recall information from experiences or gather information from provided sources to answer a question.

5A95D409B07045FCBA6A85CF18972172.description: Participate in shared research and writing projects (e.g., explore a number of books on a specific topic and produce simple findings).

4BC58629647F4E6AA8564F3482F1807E.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

848C13CA994A4F4D87A8AFE1E917B61A.description: With guidance and support from adults, explore a variety of digital tools to produce some writing, including in collaboration with peers.

34DC4A67CAA04C9387020E8F6D01C17C.description: With prompting and support, respond to questions and add details to strengthen writing as needed.

E1A592E68B9841D685367B485A3FFF8A.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to narrate a single event or several loosely linked events and provide a reaction to what happened.

6A11FFA77A394659B85F53E71D3ABD40.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose informative/explanatory texts in which they name what they are writing about and supply some information about the topic.

39FAE00BA1E1417DBD83EDD6C182E47A.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose opinion pieces in which they tell a reader the topic or the name of the book they are writing about and state an opinion or preference about the topic or book (e.g., My favorite book isâ€¦).

79BC2F2415464FD29230809ABE1D62D9.description: Read grade-appropriate texts with purpose and understanding.

602937744B9A4863AD06D96025A86A75.description: Distinguish between similarly spelled words by identifying the sounds of the letters that differ (e.g., hat, fat, rat; cap, cup, cop; him, hip, hit).

80F5E78453E44FA4AF018E46D461509C.description: Read common high-frequency words by sight (e.g., the, of, to, you, she, my, is, are, do, does).

32220F8291C6426ABAC6F0EC07FEE5D5.description: Associate the long and short sounds with the five major vowel graphemes (a, e, i, o, u), using open and closed syllable types (e.g., open-go, closed-got).

9C5E413B1B9949168B6C761939B896AD.description: Demonstrate basic knowledge of one-to-one letter-sound correspondences by producing the most frequently used sound for each consonant.

EAD5A73BB7B04A4F81760D21A3BF6829.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.

7981A3C46B9B47C0BFF597C9CC010312.description: Add or substitute individual sounds (phonemes) in simple, one-syllable words to make new words.

7A2BF302A8C743BF9DCB6E094EE52D87.description: Isolate and pronounce the initial, medial vowel, and final sounds (phonemes) in three-phoneme (consonant-vowel-consonant or CVC) words. (This does not include CVCs ending with /l/, /r/, or /x/.)

FFDDCC988A484984A94D7E8E9092BEC7.description: Blend and segment onsets and rimes of one-syllable spoken words.

AF9A60E8AF404F2BADD2C82D50A073FC.description: Count, pronounce, blend, and segment syllables in spoken words.

08EB1746294646F3805FD99EB6B9CC40.description: Recognize and produce rhyming words orally.

18772D61D900496AAF610E564E98011D.description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes).

620CB2771CE9472FBD51C171461D4D56.description: Recognize and name all upper- and lowercase letters of the alphabet.

01793B451DD94BA08D0719D35B12CC43.description: Understand that words are separated by spaces in print.

0F3B268A22E44EEB95B391EB4FC07FB6.description: Recognize that spoken words are represented in written language by specific sequences of letters and that print carries meaning.

9B413E6F6EF248019275F5CBADE345B1.description: Follow words from left to right, top to bottom, and page by page.

4CF1FACDF51D44E08328547C8F7C91C0.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.

776DA4E1BB9D459A9700FD28B4CBB1DA.description: Actively engage in teacher-led reading activities with purpose and understanding.

963E2A8B9CEE4953A44AEC80608E4A61.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

328318891F0D4AB097E0401728810321.description: With prompting and support, compare and contrast the characters (e.g., adventures and experiences) in familiar stories.

8CBDE32D6FF549D49EF4782CD06DBB7D.description: With prompting and support, describe the relationship between illustrations and the story in which they appear (e.g., based on this picture, what is happening?).

EC05E008C51A4E5795DEA07CD51266BD.description: With prompting and support, name the author and illustrator of a story and define the role of each in telling the story.

112290782D274231A9EDC81C9772E564.description: Recognize common types of text (e.g., storybooks, poems).

EDA63F64748845079EB21E07C3AD22CE.description: Ask and answer questions about unknown words in a text.

973501F0F2FC41328E3B89EDBE0644B2.description: With prompting and support, identify characters, settings, and major events in a story.

5401A57A48D342AFB465A90A080FE97F.description: With prompting and support, retell familiar stories, including key details.

D213E27714BB479BA6656EF9B6CAA09D.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

4A7F11CE4AE543D2AFD6052D385C82A2.description: Actively engage in teacher-led reading activities with purpose and understanding

6BE71ECC57DA4DBD82F54BB37253943C.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

9DA7C07330E94BF9989E2E5B7237CAD3.description: With prompting and support, identify basic similarities and differences between two texts on the same topic (e.g., in illustrations, descriptions, or procedures).

7FADC5FADECB428D9338ABC915D6A93D.description: With prompting and support, identify the details an author gives to support points in a text.

86B01B6B9D134813B96316FBBB4542E0.description: With prompting and support, describe the relationship between visual images and the text in which they appear (e.g., what person, place, thing, or idea in the text a visual image depicts).

2129C6D47B7D4787A3AEEE06C67B6644.description: Name the author and illustrator of a text and define the role of each in presenting the ideas or information in a text.

6BB3E79EDE924EF3B825D51BC6033DA0.description: Identify the front cover, back cover, and title page of a book.

5F2D5FDD083D4412AAFC4B574800C71D.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about unknown words in a text.

0161D356BBBB4E1CAE6B2AD63C7D6263.description: With prompting and support, describe the connection between two topics (individuals, events, ideas, or scientific concepts).

D97FC5DE4D3648CFBB63E1E8BA3F2CB7.description: With prompting and support, identify the main topic and retell key details of a text.

A1B7E2BC7A094DFBAE5B08D91581818C.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

720148875164430FBE2053C9FBF02436.description: Acquire and use accurately a range of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases sufficient for reading, writing, speaking, and listening; demonstrate independence in gathering vocabulary knowledge when encountering an unknown term important to comprehension or expression.

250B54ADEFCC404B8E1F738752F806C2.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.

0F50151CC4B24A0296638F4BB981653B.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases by using context clues, analyzing meaningful word parts, and consulting general and specialized reference materials, as appropriate.

E2FEC4A3E9B74A5EAFE93A3C3C6A6890.description: Apply knowledge of language to understand how language functions in different contexts, to make effective choices for meaning or style, and to comprehend more fully when reading or listening.

F9D3C080295C4D749E60C0ABDF563EBD.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

2D672E03131243C08D6BDB53797A38FA.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

18F330522D8946B683499F550FB5528A.description: Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and communicative tasks, demonstrating command of formal English when indicated or appropriate.

3C77F816F21B4CFEA750D0F3866888CE.description: Make strategic use of digital media and visual displays of data to express information and enhance understanding of presentations.

5E775939173A4DC2AC780ADCC31F08F3.description: Present information, findings, and supporting evidence with organization, development, and style appropriate to task, purpose, and audience so that listeners can follow the line of reasoning.

A75D625738674EE98604FB1C0BA10A7D.description: Evaluate a speaker's perspective, reasoning, and use of evidence and rhetoric.

3F3822FF6C2548D2A1D8B9CC84A035E5.description: Integrate and evaluate information presented in diverse media such as visual, quantitative, and oral.

01894343B3974F4387C65682248C3B7E.description: Prepare for and participate effectively in a range of conversations and collaborations with diverse partners, building on others' ideas and expressing their own clearly and persuasively.

3C2597BF25994649A5A8AE59F9602C3F.description: Anchor Standards for Speaking and Listening

D1E0C24502EB467A9F22B5F493527852.description: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of tasks, purposes, and audiences.

4370B78D480C4959863C852F0B1F0605.description: Draw evidence from literary and/or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, research, and synthesis.

BBB0553B5CF440EC87D404C373C5A046.description: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, assess the credibility and accuracy of each source, and integrate the information while avoiding plagiarism.

971AC1CC43CA45E58846EE33E761043C.description: Conduct short as well as more sustained research projects based on focused questions, demonstrating understanding of the subject under investigation.

26F73CA870CD434684173E20D8A8EB6A.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

52C1E5CFD07648FDB3BF35431BAE9C72.description: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing and to interact and collaborate with others.

E499D70177144520BA98D89CF74C9433.description: Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach.

113D56839D754FD49FF691F3B171329C.description: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

105CAC0F7F09477DA6332FED25ADD6E8.description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, well-chosen details and well-structured event sequences.

8E3A9F22D034493CA44678CC027C3EB9.description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas and information clearly and accurately through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content.

2A8E9B15204244F0A798230A68838051.description: Write arguments to support claims when analyzing substantive topics or texts using valid reasoning and relevant, sufficient evidence.

20F47B5B63774FE4B1D0BF0F00D5EB62.description: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently.

75B69E2B9DCC45259E86019FD2DBFBD0.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

049851E9E82541F3973BD16224DE1CBE.description: Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge or to compare the approaches of the author(s).

4C91D013DC014262B3E5D91BE385DD4A.description: Analyze and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as well as the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence

5335129A6E464FA99E190FA0EBC8D175.description: Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats.

55D14CD50E094B0E8DF04B35D8FC99A3.description: Assess how point of view, perspective, and/or purpose shape the content and style of a text.

9A46B06C51B84525A1D66485750EBCBE.description: Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text (e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.

F8B877FB9E4E411480E8747CA61CE5CC.description: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text, including determining technical, connotative, and figurative meanings; analyze how specific word choices shape meaning and/or tone.

E6A94BD8278344AE8F3CFB18DB6F7231.description: Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

5A5A6C42FAB84FFEB8D3A3E373208A68.description: Determine central ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting details and ideas.

E1CE6CD11793493DAFFCBAD5BB965A92.description: Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.
